page.title: 18The N.E. Chase.
page.content: This is an area of gradually rising ground to a height of 152 metres. There is a pleasant valley which has public access with many footpaths that lead further into the Chase. There is much deciduous woodland with a stream flowing northwards to the River Trent. The land is marshy. There is a large herd of fallow deer which frequent this area. Part of the area is marked as a Danger Area because of its use as a Rifle Range with 12 butts and a range of 300 metres. There are also disused sand and gravel pits in this part. Some of the land is open scrub where there is evidence of much wildlife. Bracken covers much of this scrubland together with rose bay willow herb. To the eastern edge of the Chase there is a pleasant valley through which flows the Stafford Brook. There is the site of a former mill and disused mill pond.
